miPhysics.Engine

Class PhysicsContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • miPhysics.Engine.PhysicsContext

  • public class PhysicsContext
extends java.lang.Object
    The global physics context, inside which we can define physical models.

    • Field Summary

        Returns:

      • setSimRate

        public void setSimRate(int rate)
        Set the simulation's sample rate.
        Parameters:
        rate - the rate to set the simulation to (physics frame-per-second).

      • colEngine

        public CollisionEngine colEngine()
        Get the collision engine.
        Returns:
        the engine.

      • computeScene

        public void computeScene()
        Run the physics simulation (call once every draw method). Automatically computes the correct number of steps depending on the simulation rate / display rate ratio. Should be called once the model creation is finished and the init() method has been called.

      • computeNSteps

        public void computeNSteps(int N)
        Explicitly compute N steps of the physical simulation. Should be called once the model creation is finished and the init() method has been called.
        Parameters:
        N - number of steps to compute.

      • computeSingleStep

        public void computeSingleStep()
        Compute a single step of the physical simulation. Should be called once the model creation is finished and the init() method has been called.

      • createMassSubset

        public int createMassSubset(java.lang.String name)
        Create an empty Mass module subset item. Module references will be associated to this specific key later.
        Parameters:
        name - the identifier for this subset.
        Returns:
        0 if success, -1 otherwise.

      • addMassToSubset

        public int addMassToSubset(Mass m,
                           java.lang.String subsetName)
        Add a Mass module to a given subset.
        Parameters:
        m - the mass module to reference.
        subsetName - the subset to add the module to.
        Returns:
        0 if success, -1 if fail.

      • createInteractionSubset

        public int createInteractionSubset(java.lang.String name)
        Create an empty Interaction module subset item. Module references will be associated to this specific key later.
        Parameters:
        name - the identifier for this subset.
        Returns:
        0 if success, -1 otherwise.
